content.description:
Climb the broken crack/flake system just left of the large pine tree in the center of the face on the south side of The Corridor. Near the top, traverse on a ledge to the right, and use

Unknown 5.8's

anchor to descend.
content.location: This is the trad route left of the left bolted line on the south side of The Corridor.

content.description:
Start near the large pine tree. Begin the climb, step left at the second bolt (crux), and climb easier terrain to the top. The bolts are somewhat runout near the top, but the route is still safe.

This shares an anchor with

Buttered Side Up

.
content.location: This is the left bolted line on the south side of The Corridor.

content.description:
The route follows the only wandering crack to the top. The crack starts off at 2 1/2" and gets smaller as you go. Gear is required for anchors above.

As of 2nd ascent on 3/11, it still needs cleaning. The more the better. It is a very fun route with a couple of good rests for the new .9 leader.
content.protection: Gear to 2 1/2 inches with lots of smaller stuff.
content.location: Hike down the  "Wall Street" gully, and turn left.

content.description: This is a fun and delicate face climb with careful and powerful moves. It is harder than it looks from the bottom, but it has good stances. If anyone knows the proper name of route/FA party, please let me know (I'm curious about this area as a whole).
content.location:
The Corridor.

Walk to the western end facing the river and turn right (North). It is the only climb on the small face. From the ground, you can see previously chopped bolted anchors just up and left of new ones. This climb is between a short block and a bolted arete.

content.description:
This is the obvious offwidth crack on the north side of The Corridor. Considering the bolt/bolt chopping banter and rhetoric for the area, I'm super surprised this crack is bolted. I led the crack entirely on gear where all of the placements were textbook. An advantage to clipping the bolts is perhaps the less work required on lead. Don't blow clipping the 3rd bolt or you'll likely deck....

Climb to a small ledge, and then fire up the offwidth crack as it narrows. Pull the small roof where the crack disappears, and then desperately clip the anchor.
content.protection: 3 draws + an anchor OR a select single set of BD C4 #0.5-5. The #4 & #5 protect the lower section of the climb well.
content.location: It ascends the obvious offwidth crack on the north side of The Corridor.

content.description:
This natural line starts in a nice, 5.5 or 5.6 chimney. Work your way past a chockstone and stand on top. Head up a crack to the right, straight to a two bolt anchor.

This line was bolted for a few years, but the bolts were chopped as of 4/22/14.
content.protection: Single rack, with some finger-sized cams for the very top. The bolts were chopped as of 4/22/14.
content.location: This is halfway down the Wallstreet Gully on the right.

content.description: Climb the wall either to the right or left of the bush, and then continue up as the angle lowers and the protection disappears. Enjoy the featured slab to the top.
content.protection: A #0.3 Camalot in the small pocket right of the bush or a #2 Camalot in the horizontal left of the bush, a large stopper in the last horizontal, and then slab to the topout. Sling a tree for belay.
content.location: In the river corridor area below Turtle Rock, this route is between a left-facing dihedral to its left and a nice boulder to traverse across to its right. Look for a bush ~10 feet up the wall.

content.description: Climb up to a small roof, clip the high third bolt, and finesse the crux to easier terrain leading to the anchors.
content.location: This is right bolted line on the south side of The Corridor.

content.description:
This is a very fun route! Easy 5.4 climbing takes you up to ledge. From there, you climb about 30 feet of dihedral finger/hand crack with some stemming and a few poor faceholds. The crux is located about halfway up the crack.

This is a great climb and would maybe be 4 stars if the dihedral lasted for the whole route. Shout out to Griffin for love.
content.protection: Get good protection with some smaller gear for the bottom and a few hand-sized pieces for the top. Build a gear anchor at the top, or top out and walk off.
content.location: At the river end of the chamber, turn left and follow that SW face until it starts bending back toward the SE.

pathTokens: Turtle Rocks, Baby Turtle, and The Corridor
